VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were 1 substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. This was within investigation 2023C0000523 dated July 17, 2023, which
found the facility in non-compliance of a staff member dragging a youth across the
room and placing her arm on the youth's neck when the youth was escalated. A
corrective action plan was approved on July 28, 2023, that included the staff
member involved attend a four-hour restraint training refresher and meet with the
court restraint trainier to review the video. All other staff completed a refresher of
the training. During the monitoring period of the CAP, the staff involved ended up
leaving her employment at the facility.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: Special
investigation 2023C0000523 with CAP approval date July 28, 2023 was a result a
violation for staff not following the approved restraint model and not following the
internal policy of documenting youth's behaviors at the end of shift. The agency
has retrained their staff on documentation and restraint model. The agency has
complied with all action steps within the CAP. DCWL monitored CAP compliance
for six months on a quarterly basis.

N/A

N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not applicable.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection. The staff reported they feel
well supported by their direct line supervisor and upper administration. Staff
reported they complete a lot of training within the facility and provided the
feedback that they would like to have more in person training versus online
trainings. One staff provided feedback to have a team meeting about the online
trainings and how the information they learned could be applied to their current
roles. This feedback was shared with administration.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. The youth reported they
feel safe at the facility and are treated well by staff. The youth reported they feel
their grievances have all been taken seriously and have been addressed by
administration.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on May 16, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
